ml.alternet.parser.handlers

Interface ValueMapper<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the values.
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Mappers<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    NodeBuilder, TreeHandler, ValueBuilder

    public interface ValueMapper<T>
    Transform tokens and rules to values. The context of the transformation is narrowed to the current token and its next values, or to the current rule and its arguments.
    Author:
    Philippe Poulard
    See Also:
    RuleMapper, TokenMapper, Mappers

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  ValueMapper.Value<V>
      Holds <V> or EventsHandler.TokenValue or EventsHandler.RuleStart

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ValueMapper.Value<T> ruleToValue(Grammar.Rule rule, Deque<ValueMapper.Value<T>> args)
      Transform a rule and its arguments to a a custom value of the target data structure.
      ValueMapper.Value<T> tokenToValue(EventsHandler.TokenValue<?> token, Deque<ValueMapper.Value<T>> next)
      Transform a token value to a custom value of the target data structure.

    • Method Detail

      • tokenToValue

        ValueMapper.Value<T> tokenToValue(EventsHandler.TokenValue<?> token,
                                  Deque<ValueMapper.Value<T>> next)
        Transform a token value to a custom value of the target data structure.
        Parameters:
        token - The actual token.
        next - The next values within the boundaries of the current rule. For example, if your grammar can parse "+ 123" and that "+" is the token, then "123" is the first item within the next values.
        Returns:
        A value

      • ruleToValue

        ValueMapper.Value<T> ruleToValue(Grammar.Rule rule,
                                 Deque<ValueMapper.Value<T>> args)
        Transform a rule and its arguments to a a custom value of the target data structure. The boundaries of the rule are defined by the rule start and rule end events, the events within are considered as argument (unless they are marked as fragments).
        Parameters:
        rule - The actual rule
        args - The elements between rule start and rule end
        Returns:
        A value, or null to discard the rule and merge the args with the args of the nested rule.
        See Also:
        EventsHandler.RuleStart, EventsHandler.RuleEnd, Grammar.Fragment
